reviews.review_msg: Expect no feedback from her class. Normally a sessional instructor for Labour Studies. Hers notes are very repetitive, very disorganized, not what you should expect from an 100 level intro class  doesnt know how to use ppt lectures are such a mess Avoid her and Sarah at all costs!!!

Both she and Dr. Ayers are great but both are also tough markers, so you can't just squeak by in this class.  You have to do the readings and understand the theories.  Marks hard on the final but was fair on the paper. The paper is due really early in the course,so if your topic is from the latter half of the course you are at a disadvantage.
She is new to teaching but she is awesome. Very helpful and a fair marker, she helps you a lot if you go see her. She is super smart as well!

She's terrific because she has the right balance of empathy and honesty, which is exactly what a teacher should have so the marking is not too easy but not merciless either. I have learned a lot in her classes about my strengths and weaknesses. I wish there were more like her. I wish her all the best in the future.
You learn a lot from her but she is pretty tough when it comes to marking.
